oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill in a Civil War murder case from Morgan County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Louisa Webb, widow of Union recruiter John Webb, sues William Williams, Martin Stinecipher, Joseph Justice, Alfred Wallace, Franklin Gibson, and Henry Gibson in Morgan County Chancery Court for failure to pay a judgement of $50,000 from a previous case. John Webb, a Union loyalist, was murdered by these individuals for being a Union recruiter. Mrs. Webb is seeking relief from the chancellor because "there is no organized circuit court or clerk now" operating in Morgan County.
